tourName: Luxury Ecuador and Galapagos tailor made holiday
generalInfo:
Situated on the equator, Ecuador is the smallest country in the Andean Highlands. Despite its size, it is probably the world's most bio-diverse country, crammed with an astounding variety of wildlife, birds and vegetation existing in contrasting climatic zones.

With its beautiful colonial architecture, magnificent panoramic scenery, vibrant indigenous groups and welcoming people. Ecuador is one of the most enticing and rewarding countries to visit in South America. And, as if it needed any further promotion, one of the world's greatest treasures of natural history lies in the bewitching Galapagos Islands, famed for the fearless and unique wildlife that inspired Charles Darwin, the island chain is roundly considered the highlight of any holiday in Ecuador.

Many travellers consider a visit to the Galapagos the most epic and coveted wildlife destination on the planet - and for good reason. The choice of itineraries and options an be overwhelming, but if you're going to do this just once, we highly recommend doing it in style! With first hand experience of the most delightful accommodations, expert local guides and a thorough understanding of the logistics, we can help you craft the best itinerary for the most memorable trip.

dayInfo.description: Arrival transfer into the heart of Quito, staying at the stunning Relais & Chateaux Casa Gangotena. Quito, the capital of Ecuador, lies on the slopes of the Andes’ mighty Pichincha volcano in the Guayllabamba river basin. The city’s Old Town is its main attraction - one of the most well preserved in Latin America and the first-ever UNESCO heritage site. Wander among ancient, colourful streets; pop into glorious historic churches; or spend an afternoon browsing the vibrant Mercado (markets) and learning about the unique, traditional Ecuadorian Sierra culture. Numerous gorgeous public parks and a thriving and exciting culinary scene complete the package.

A TASTE OF OLD TOWN QUITO Experience a culinary journey through Quito, tasting its most popular flavors and traditions with our Taste of Old Town Quito tour. This full-day tour takes you to the most iconic food spots and cultural experiences, perfectly showcasing the heritage of the city, with a focus on Ecuadorian cuisine.

Wild Cotapaxi. Embark on an incomparable full day adventure through the breathtaking landscapes of Cotopaxi. Encounter one of the highest active volcanoes in the world, explore an hacienda with a history that dates back six centuries, and enjoy a unique vodka tasting afternoon.

Mashpi Biodiversity Reserve Located in the northwest corner of the Metropolitan District of Quito, the Mashpi Biodiversity Reserve stands out as a unique and extraordinary destination. Encompassing an expansive area of 2800 hectares, this reserve encompasses both cloud forest and rainforest, contributing to the globally-significant Choco biodiversity hotspot. Recognised as one of the most important eco-lodges in Ecuador, this immersive and active experiencce really is something special.

Mashpi Lodge does not have a set programme and the expert guides will organise the day around your preferences. You could start at sunrise on the panoramic terrace, watching -and hearing- a flock of birds flying around the lodge. After breakfast, you can walk to a waterfall, bathe in the dramatic water jet, and then head to the Hummingbird Garden. Another option is to discover the wonderful butterflies at the Life Center. After lunch, you can cycle between two points in the forest about 200m apart on the Aerial Bike, followed by reaching and climbing the Observation Tower to enjoy the Reserve in its entirety and watch the sun set behind the mountains and clouds…
Puembo Depart the cloud forest and return to a pleasant suburb of Quito for a relaxing night at La Palma Polo Club

This morning, take the early flight to Baltra Island where your Galapagos adventure will begin onboard the beautiful midsize yacht, La Pinta. Launch straight into your adventure with a short hike with your resident biologists on South Plaza island. This stunning island offers a perfect introduction to the unique natural wonders of the Galapagos archipelago.

Explore Santa Fe Island, part of the “Humboldt quartet” of islands in the Galapagos. It’s a hotspot for genetic diversity and home to unique species like the Galapagos hawk and the elusive Santa Fe land iguana. Enjoy kayaking, snorkeling, and coastal exploration in the morning for a memorable visit. After a fulfilling lunch, we visited Puerto Baquerizo Moreno, where Charles Darwin first set foot in the Galapagos Islands. We then drove to Cerro, Colorado, to see the breeding center for giant tortoises in a captivating deciduous forest.

After arriving at Punta Pitt on the eastern tip of San Cristobal Island, you can enjoy a coastal trail with views of frigates and sea lions. Look out for various species of boobies. After, you can take a panga ride or go snorkeling to explore the marine life further.

Explore Punta Suarez in the morning to see unique lava terrain and remarkable seabird colonies. Keep an eye out for waved albatrosses, boobies, swallow-tail gulls, and the stunning “blowhole” lava formation against the backdrop of the Humboldt Current. Look for colorful marine iguanas. This visit promises unforgettable encounters. In the afternoon, we’ll visit Gardner Bay’s pristine white coral beach. Here, you can observe playful sea lions, graceful mockingbirds, and charming finches or enjoy snorkeling, kayaking, or a glass-bottom boat ride to explore marine life.

Depart the yacht this morning. We visit the Charles Darwin Research Station and its giant tortoise captive-rearing program, then transfer to Finch Bay hotel. Afternoon at leisure to explore the town or relax at the hotel.
Board the hotel's day charter yacht to visit nearby islands and encounter more of the amazing Galapagos residents not already sen.

HALF-DAY TORTUGA BAY A stunning adventure… Embark on a half-day journey and immerse in the breathtaking beauty of Tortuga Bay, renowned for its pristine white sands and crystal-clear waters. Begin your adventure with a scenic walk along a picturesque trail leading to this stunning beach, where the sands feel as soft as talcum powder beneath your feet, contrasting beautifully with the deep turquoise of the sea. As you arrive at the beach, marvel at the captivating views of Playa Brava, famous for its powerful waves and as a habitat for iconic Galapagos wildlife. Keep an eye out for sightings of herons, marine iguanas, and playful sea lions basking in the sun along the shoreline. Take a leisurely stroll to Playa Mansa, a serene bay with calm waters perfect for swimming, kayaking, and snorkeling. Here, you can observe marine species such as iguanas, sharks, turtles, and rays from the comfort of the shore. Spend your morning or afternoon exploring the wonders of Tortuga Bay, where every step reveals a new vista of natural splendor and adventure.
This morning, take a flight back to Quito and spend the evening at a historic hacienda, where you can indulge in a massage or wander the hotel's pitcturesque gardens
Depart from Quito Airport this morning
